content.text: Rolling from the tummy to the back through both sides (right & left) and rolling from the back to the tummy through both sides (right & left).

Keeping the symmetry of the muscles and therefore of the skeleton is very Important! There is supposed to be no preferred side in this age. It’s the first step for independence for your baby. They can choose to get to places that they want. This is the stage that prepares for the ability of the body for arm crawling (crawling on the stomach).

If you are seeing that your baby has a hard time achieving the specific milestones described in the description or are at the age of 7 months and can’t do those things you should  consult with a pediatric or an Infant development guide in order to learn how to help your baby to achieve these important abilities that are the foundation of their physical, sensory and emotional needs:

ul: Rolling from the tummy to their back through both the right and left sides.
Rolling from the back to their tummy through both the right and left sides.
When the rolling is  achieved we would like to see that it happens smoothly with flexibility and without any stiffness.
